00034 void MIDI_Class::begin(const byte inChannel) {
00035         
00036         // Initialise the Serial port
00037         USE_SERIAL_PORT.begin(MIDI_BAUDRATE);
00038         
00039         
00040 #if COMPFLAG_MIDI_OUT
00041         
00042 #if USE_RUNNING_STATUS
00043         mRunningStatus_TX = InvalidType;
00044 #endif // USE_RUNNING_STATUS
00045         
00046 #endif // COMPFLAG_MIDI_OUT
00047         
00048         
00049 #if COMPFLAG_MIDI_IN
00050         
00051         mInputChannel = inChannel;
00052         mRunningStatus_RX = InvalidType;
00053         mPendingMessageIndex = 0;
00054         mPendingMessageExpectedLenght = 0;
00055         
00056         mMessage.valid = false;
00057         mMessage.type = InvalidType;
00058         mMessage.channel = 0;
00059         mMessage.data1 = 0;
00060         mMessage.data2 = 0;
00061         
00062 #endif // COMPFLAG_MIDI_IN
00063         
00064         
00065 #if (COMPFLAG_MIDI_IN && COMPFLAG_MIDI_OUT) // Thru
00066         
00067         mThruFilterMode = Full;
00068         
00069 #endif // Thru
00070         
00071 }

00076 // Private method for generating a status byte from channel and type
00077 const byte MIDI_Class::genstatus(const kMIDIType inType,const byte inChannel) {
00078         return ((byte)inType | ((inChannel-1) & 0x0F));
00079 }
00080 
00087 void MIDI_Class::send(kMIDIType type, byte data1, byte data2, byte channel) {
00088         
00089         // Then test if channel is valid
00090         if (channel >= MIDI_CHANNEL_OFF || channel == MIDI_CHANNEL_OMNI) {
00091                 
00092 #if USE_RUNNING_STATUS  
00093                 mRunningStatus_TX = InvalidType;
00094 #endif 
00095                 
00096                 return; // Don't send anything
00097         }
00098         
00099         switch (type) {
00100                         // Channel messages
00101                 case NoteOff:
00102                 case NoteOn:
00103                 case ProgramChange:
00104                 case ControlChange:
00105                 case PitchBend:
00106                 case AfterTouchPoly:
00107                 case AfterTouchChannel: 
00108                 {
00109                         
00110                         // Protection: remove MSBs on data
00111                         data1 &= 0x7F;
00112                         data2 &= 0x7F;
00113                         
00114                         byte statusbyte = genstatus(type,channel);
00115                         
00116 #if USE_RUNNING_STATUS
00117                         // Check Running Status
00118                         if (mRunningStatus_TX != statusbyte) {
00119                                 // New message, memorise and send header
00120                                 mRunningStatus_TX = statusbyte;
00121                                 USE_SERIAL_PORT.write(mRunningStatus_TX);
00122                         }
00123 #else
00124                         // Don't care about running status, send the Control byte.
00125                         USE_SERIAL_PORT.write(statusbyte);
00126 #endif
00127                         
00128                         // Then send data
00129                         USE_SERIAL_PORT.write(data1);
00130                         if (type != ProgramChange && type != AfterTouchChannel) {
00131                                 USE_SERIAL_PORT.write(data2);
00132                         }
00133                 }
00134                         break;
00135                         
00136                         // Real Time messages
00137                 case Clock:
00138                 case Start:
00139                 case Stop:      
00140                 case Continue:
00141                 case ActiveSensing:
00142                 case SystemReset:
00143                 case TuneRequest: // Not really real-time, but one byte anyway.
00144                         sendRealTime(type);
00145                         break;
00146                         
00147                 default:
00148                         break;
00149         }
00150         
00151         
00152 }

00192 void MIDI_Class::sendAfterTouch(byte Pressure,byte Channel) { send(AfterTouchChannel,Pressure,0,Channel); }

00198 void MIDI_Class::sendPitchBend(unsigned int PitchValue,byte Channel) {
00199 
00200         send(PitchBend,(PitchValue & 0x7F),(PitchValue >> 7) & 0x7F,Channel);
00201         
00202 }
00207 void MIDI_Class::sendPitchBend(double PitchValue,byte Channel) {
00208 
00209         unsigned int pitchval = (PitchValue+1.f)*8192;
00210         if (pitchval > 16383) pitchval = 16383;         // overflow protection
00211         sendPitchBend(pitchval,Channel);
00212         
00213 }

00221 void MIDI_Class::sendSysEx(byte length, byte * array, bool ArrayContainsBoundaries) {
00222         if (!ArrayContainsBoundaries) USE_SERIAL_PORT.write(0xF0);
00223         for (byte i=0;i<length;i++) USE_SERIAL_PORT.write(array[i]);
00224         if (!ArrayContainsBoundaries) USE_SERIAL_PORT.write(0xF7);
00225 }

00234 void MIDI_Class::sendTimeCodeQuarterFrame(byte TypeNibble, byte ValuesNibble) {
00235         
00236         byte data = ( ((TypeNibble & 0x07) << 4) | (ValuesNibble & 0x0F) );
00237         sendTimeCodeQuarterFrame(data);
00238         
00239 }
00240 
00244 void MIDI_Class::sendTimeCodeQuarterFrame(byte data) {
00245         
00246         USE_SERIAL_PORT.write(TimeCodeQuarterFrame);
00247         USE_SERIAL_PORT.write(data);
00248         
00249 }

00254 void MIDI_Class::sendSongPosition(unsigned int Beats) {
00255         
00256         USE_SERIAL_PORT.write(SongPosition);
00257         USE_SERIAL_PORT.write(Beats & 0x7F);
00258         USE_SERIAL_PORT.write((Beats >> 7) & 0x7F);
00259         
00260 }

00263 void MIDI_Class::sendSongSelect(byte SongNumber) {
00264         
00265         USE_SERIAL_PORT.write(SongSelect);
00266         USE_SERIAL_PORT.write(SongNumber & 0x7F);
00267         
00268 }

00273 void MIDI_Class::sendRealTime(kMIDIType Type) {
00274         switch (Type) {
00275                 case TuneRequest: // Not really real-time, but one byte anyway.
00276                 case Clock:
00277                 case Start:
00278                 case Stop:      
00279                 case Continue:
00280                 case ActiveSensing:
00281                 case SystemReset:
00282                         USE_SERIAL_PORT.write((byte)Type);
00283                         break;
00284                 default:
00285                         // Invalid Real Time marker
00286                         break;
00287         }
00288 }

00301 bool MIDI_Class::read() {
00302         return read(mInputChannel);

00304 
00306 bool MIDI_Class::read(const byte inChannel) {
00307         
00308         if (inChannel >= MIDI_CHANNEL_OFF) return false; // MIDI Input disabled.
00309         
00310         if (parse(inChannel)) return filter(inChannel);
00311         else return false;
00312         
00313 }
00314 
00315 // Private method: MIDI parser
00316 bool MIDI_Class::parse(byte inChannel) { 
00317         
00318         // If the buffer is full -> Don't Panic! Call the Vogons to destroy it.
00319         if (USE_SERIAL_PORT.available() == UART_BUFFER_SIZE) { Serial << "Overflow, call the Vogons!!" << endl;
00320                 USE_SERIAL_PORT.flush();
00321         }       
00322         
00323         if (USE_SERIAL_PORT.available() <= 0) {
00324                 // No data available.
00325                 return false;
00326         }
00327         else {
00328                 
00329                 /* Parsing algorithm:
00330                  Get a byte from the serial buffer.
00331                  • If there is no pending message to be recomposed, start a new one.
00332                         - Find type and channel (if pertinent)
00333                         - Look for other bytes in buffer, call parser recursively, until the message is assembled or the buffer is empty.
00334                  • Else, add the extracted byte to the pending message, and check validity. When the message is done, store it.
00335                  */
00336                 
00337                 
00338                 byte extracted = USE_SERIAL_PORT.read();
00339                 
00340                 if (mPendingMessageIndex == 0) { // Start a new pending message
00341                         mPendingMessage[0] = extracted;
00342                         
00343                         // Check for running status first
00344                         switch (getTypeFromStatusByte(mRunningStatus_RX)) {
00345                                         // Only these types allow Running Status:
00346                                 case NoteOff:
00347                                 case NoteOn:
00348                                 case AfterTouchPoly:
00349                                 case ControlChange:
00350                                 case ProgramChange:
00351                                 case AfterTouchChannel:
00352                                 case PitchBend: 
00353                                         
00354                                         // If the status byte is not received, prepend it to the pending message
00355                                         if (extracted < 0x80) {
00356                                                 mPendingMessage[0] = mRunningStatus_RX;
00357                                                 mPendingMessage[1] = extracted;
00358                                                 mPendingMessageIndex = 1;
00359                                         }
00360                                         // Else: well, we received another status byte, so the running status does not apply here.
00361                                         // It will be updated upon completion of this message.
00362                                         
00363                                         break;
00364                                         
00365                                 default:
00366                                         // No running status
00367                                         break;
00368                         }
00369                         
00370                         
00371                         switch (getTypeFromStatusByte(mPendingMessage[0])) {
00372                                         
00373                                         // 1 byte messages
00374                                 case Start:
00375                                 case Continue:
00376                                 case Stop:
00377                                 case Clock:
00378                                 case ActiveSensing:
00379                                 case SystemReset:
00380                                 case TuneRequest:
00381                                         // Handle the message type directly here.
00382                                         mMessage.type = getTypeFromStatusByte(mPendingMessage[0]);
00383                                         mMessage.channel = 0;
00384                                         mMessage.data1 = 0;
00385                                         mMessage.data2 = 0;
00386                                         mMessage.valid = true;
00387                                         mPendingMessageExpectedLenght = 0;
00388                                         mPendingMessageIndex = 0;
00389                                         mRunningStatus_RX = InvalidType;
00390                                         return true;
00391                                         break;
00392                                         
00393                                         // 2 bytes messages
00394                                 case ProgramChange:
00395                                 case AfterTouchChannel:
00396                                 case TimeCodeQuarterFrame:
00397                                 case SongSelect:
00398                                         mPendingMessageExpectedLenght = 2;
00399                                         break;
00400                                         
00401                                         // 3 bytes messages
00402                                 case NoteOn:
00403                                 case NoteOff:
00404                                 case ControlChange:
00405                                 case PitchBend:
00406                                 case AfterTouchPoly:
00407                                 case SongPosition:
00408                                         mPendingMessageExpectedLenght = 3;
00409                                         break;
00410                                         
00411                                 case SystemExclusive:
00412                                         mPendingMessageExpectedLenght = MIDI_SYSEX_ARRAY_SIZE; // As the message can be any lenght between 3 and MIDI_SYSEX_ARRAY_SIZE bytes
00413                                         break;
00414                                         
00415                                 case InvalidType:
00416                                 default:
00417                                         // This is obviously wrong. Let's get the hell out'a here.
00418                                         mPendingMessageIndex = 0;
00419                                         mPendingMessageExpectedLenght = 0;
00420                                         mRunningStatus_RX = InvalidType;
00421                                         return false;
00422                                         break;
00423                         }
00424                         
00425                         // Then update the index of the pending message.
00426                         mPendingMessageIndex++;
00427                         
00428                         // And call the parser, again.
00429                         return parse(inChannel);
00430                         
00431                 }
00432                 else { 
00433                         
00434                         
00435                         // First, test if this is a status byte
00436                         if (extracted >= 0x80) {
00437                                 
00438                                 // Reception of status bytes are allowed only for interleaved Real Time message or EOX
00439                                 switch (extracted) {
00440                                         case Clock:
00441                                         case Start:
00442                                         case Continue:
00443                                         case Stop:
00444                                         case ActiveSensing:
00445                                         case SystemReset:
00446 
00447                                                 /*
00448                                                  This is tricky. Here we will have to extract the one-byte message,
00449                                                  pass it to the structure for being read outside the MIDI class,
00450                                                  and recompose the message it was interleaved into.
00451                                                  
00452                                                  Oh, and without killing the running status.. 
00453                                                  
00454                                                  This is done by leaving the pending message as is, it will be completed on next calls.
00455                                                  */
00456                                                 
00457                                                 mMessage.type = (kMIDIType)extracted;
00458                                                 mMessage.data1 = 0;
00459                                                 mMessage.data2 = 0;
00460                                                 mMessage.channel = 0;
00461                                                 mMessage.valid = true;
00462                                                 return true;
00463                                                 
00464                                                 break;
00465                                         
00466                                                 // End of Exclusive
00467                                         case 0xF7:
00468                                                 if (getTypeFromStatusByte(mPendingMessage[0]) == SystemExclusive) {
00469                                                         
00470                                                         // Store System Exclusive array in midimsg structure
00471                                                         for (byte i=0;i<MIDI_SYSEX_ARRAY_SIZE;i++) {
00472                                                                 mMessage.sysex_array[i] = mPendingMessage[i];
00473                                                         }
00474                                                         
00475                                                         // Get length
00476                                                         mMessage.data1 = mPendingMessageIndex+1;
00477                                                         mMessage.data2 = 0;
00478                                                         mMessage.channel = 0;
00479                                                         mMessage.valid = true;
00480                                                         
00481                                                         mPendingMessageIndex = 0;
00482                                                         mPendingMessageExpectedLenght = 0;
00483                                                         mRunningStatus_RX = InvalidType;
00484                                                         
00485                                                         return true;
00486                                                 }
00487                                                 else {
00488                                                         // Well well well.. error.
00489                                                         mPendingMessageIndex = 0;
00490                                                         mPendingMessageExpectedLenght = 0;
00491                                                         mRunningStatus_RX = InvalidType;
00492                                                         return false;
00493                                                 }
00494 
00495                                                 break;
00496                                         default:
00497                                                 break;
00498                                 }
00499                                 
00500                                 
00501                                 
00502                         }
00503                         
00504                         
00505                         // Add extracted data byte to pending message
00506                         mPendingMessage[mPendingMessageIndex] = extracted;
00507                         
00508                         
00509                         // Now we are going to check if we have reached the end of the message
00510                         if (mPendingMessageIndex >= (mPendingMessageExpectedLenght-1)) {
00511                                 
00512                                 // "FML" case: fall down here with an overflown SysEx..
00513                                 // This means we received the last possible data byte that can fit the buffer.
00514                                 // If this happens, try increasing MIDI_SYSEX_ARRAY_SIZE.
00515                                 if (getTypeFromStatusByte(mPendingMessage[0]) == SystemExclusive) {
00516                                         mPendingMessageIndex = 0;
00517                                         mPendingMessageExpectedLenght = 0;
00518                                         mRunningStatus_RX = InvalidType;
00519                                         return false;
00520                                 }
00521                                 
00522                                 
00523 
00524                                 
00525                                 mMessage.type = getTypeFromStatusByte(mPendingMessage[0]);
00526                                 mMessage.channel = (mPendingMessage[0] & 0x0F)+1; // Don't check if it is a Channel Message
00527                                 
00528                                 
00529                                 /*Serial << "Debug:";
00530                                 for (unsigned i=0;i<8;i++) {
00531                                         Serial << " 0x";
00532                                         Serial.printNumber(mPendingMessage[i],16);
00533                                 }
00534                                 Serial << endl;
00535                                 Serial << "ExpLen: " << (int)mPendingMessageExpectedLenght;
00536                                 Serial << "\t Index: " << (int)mPendingMessageIndex << endl;*/
00537                                 
00538                                 mMessage.data1 = mPendingMessage[1]; // Checking this is futile, as 1 byte message were processed in the switch.
00539                                 mMessage.data2 = mPendingMessage[2];
00540                                 
00541                                 // Reset local variables
00542                                 mPendingMessageIndex = 0;
00543                                 mPendingMessageExpectedLenght = 0;
00544                                 
00545                                 mMessage.valid = true;
00546                                 
00547                                 // Activate running status (if enabled for the received type)
00548                                 switch (mMessage.type) {
00549                                         case NoteOff:
00550                                         case NoteOn:
00551                                         case AfterTouchPoly:
00552                                         case ControlChange:
00553                                         case ProgramChange:
00554                                         case AfterTouchChannel:
00555                                         case PitchBend: 
00556                                                 // Running status enabled: store it from received message
00557                                                 mRunningStatus_RX = mPendingMessage[0];
00558                                                 break;
00559                                                 
00560                                         default:
00561                                                 // No running status
00562                                                 mRunningStatus_RX = InvalidType;
00563                                                 break;
00564                                 }
00565                                 //Serial << "CME" << endl;;
00566                                 //Serial.printNumber(mMessage.type,16);
00567                                 return true;
00568                         }
00569                         else {
00570                                 // Then update the index of the pending message.
00571                                 mPendingMessageIndex++;
00572                                 
00573                                 // And call the parser, again.
00574                                 return parse(inChannel);
00575                         }
00576                         
00577                 }
00578                 
00579                 
00580         }
00581         
00582         // What are our chances to fall here?
00583         return false;
00584 }

00599 bool MIDI_Class::check() { return mMessage.valid; }

00620 void MIDI_Class::setThruFilterMode(kThruFilterMode inThruFilterMode) { 
00621         mThruFilterMode = inThruFilterMode;
00622         if (mThruFilterMode != Off) mThruActivated = true;
00623         else mThruActivated = false;
00624 }
00630 void MIDI_Class::setThruFilterMode(byte inThruFilterMode) { 
00631         mThruFilterMode = (kThruFilterMode)inThruFilterMode;
00632         if (mThruFilterMode != Off) mThruActivated = true;
00633         else mThruActivated = false;
00634 }

00638 void MIDI_Class::turnThruOn(kThruFilterMode inThruFilterMode) { 
00639         mThruActivated = true;
00640         mThruFilterMode = inThruFilterMode;
00641 }
00643 void MIDI_Class::turnThruOff() {
00644         mThruActivated = false; 
00645         mThruFilterMode = Off;

00647 
00648 /* This method is called upon reception of a message and checks if the message stored is destinated to be read (matching channel).
00649         It also takes care of Thru filtering and sending.
00650  */
00651 bool MIDI_Class::filter(byte inChannel) {
00652         
00653         /*
00654                 This method handles both recognition of channel (to know if the message is destinated to the Arduino) and Soft-Thru filtering.
00655          
00656                 Soft-Thru filtering:
00657                 - All system messages (System Exclusive, Common and Real Time) are passed to output unless filter is set to Off
00658                 - Channel messages are passed to the output whether their channel is matching the input channel and the filter setting
00659          
00660          */
00661         
00662         
00663         bool validate_message = false;
00664         
00665         // First, check if the received message is Channel
00666         if (mMessage.type >= NoteOff && mMessage.type <= PitchBend) {
00667                 
00668                 // Then we need to know if we listen to it
00669                 if ((mMessage.channel == mInputChannel) || (mInputChannel == MIDI_CHANNEL_OMNI)) {
00670                         validate_message = true;
00671                         
00672                 }
00673                 else {
00674                         // We don't listen to this channel
00675                         validate_message = false;
00676                 }
00677                 
00678                 // Now let's pass it to the output
00679                 switch (mThruFilterMode) {
00680                         case Full:
00681                                 send(mMessage.type,mMessage.data1,mMessage.data2,mMessage.channel);
00682                                 break;
00683                         case SameChannel:
00684                                 if (validate_message) {
00685                                         send(mMessage.type,mMessage.data1,mMessage.data2,mMessage.channel);
00686                                 }
00687                                 break;
00688                         case DifferentChannel:
00689                                 if (!validate_message) {
00690                                         send(mMessage.type,mMessage.data1,mMessage.data2,mMessage.channel);
00691                                 }
00692                         case Off:
00693                                 // Do nothing
00694                                 break;
00695                         default:
00696                                 break;
00697                 }
00698                 
00699         }
00700         else {
00701                 
00702                 // System messages are always received
00703                 validate_message = true;
00704                 
00705                 // Send the message to the output
00706                 if (mThruFilterMode != Off) {
00707                         switch (mMessage.type) {
00708                                         // Real Time and 1 byte
00709                                 case Clock:
00710                                 case Start:
00711                                 case Stop:
00712                                 case Continue:
00713                                 case ActiveSensing:
00714                                 case SystemReset:
00715                                 case TuneRequest:       
00716                                         sendRealTime(mMessage.type);
00717                                         break;
00718                                         
00719                                 case SystemExclusive:
00720                                         // Send SysEx (0xF0 and 0xF7 are included in the buffer)
00721                                         sendSysEx(mMessage.data1,mMessage.sysex_array,true); 
00722                                         break;
00723                                         
00724                                 case SongSelect:
00725                                         sendSongSelect(mMessage.data1); // TODO: check this
00726                                         break;
00727                                         
00728                                 case SongPosition:
00729                                         sendSongPosition(mMessage.data1 | ((unsigned)mMessage.data2<<7));       // TODO: check this
00730                                         break;
00731                                 
00732                                 case TimeCodeQuarterFrame:
00733                                         sendTimeCodeQuarterFrame(mMessage.data1,mMessage.data2); // TODO: check this
00734                                         break;
00735                                 default:
00736                                         break;
00737                         }
00738                         
00739                 }
00740                 
00741         }
00742 
00743         
00744         
00745         
00746         return validate_message;
00747 }
